content.question: A <math alttext="42.0 gram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>42.0</mn><mspace></mspace><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> sample of compound containing only <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></math> was analyzed. The results showed that the sample contained <math alttext="36.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>36.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="C" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>C</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="6.0 grams" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>6.0</mn><mspace depth="0.0ex" height="0.0ex" width="0.25em"></mspace><mtext>g</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> of <math alttext="H" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following questions about the compound can be answered using the results of the analysis?

choices.label: What was the volume of the sample?
What is the molar mass of the compound?
What is the chemical stability of the compound?
What is the empirical formula of the compound?

content.answer: What is the empirical formula of the compound?

skill.text: 2.A: Identify a testable scientific question based on an observation, data, or a model.
